title.narrative: Enhance rural development through organised civil society

description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen capacities of civil society organisations and their networks to boost equal participation of rural women and men in local economic opportunities, advocate for their interests and contribute to policy harmonisation with the EU standards. Expected results are - Increased capacity of partner organisation – CERD; - Targeted rural organisations increase their capacity in leadership and management skills as well as in organisational and institutional development; - Targeted rural organisations increase their knowledge and skills in lobby and advocacy; - Policy recommendations submitted to relevant authorities for improvement; - Rural organisations increase their capacities on production, business & marketing; - Targeted organisations are capable to access the market; - Contribute to business plan implementation of targeted organisations; - Functional Marketing Export Centre and established links to markets for targeted rural organisations and small-scale farmers; - Create job opportunities and expertise for young people in the field of agriculture and rural development; - Vulnerable groups increase their business capacities; - Vulnerable groups created income through its start-up business; - Initiatives of vulnerable groups are strengthened and formalised in the cooperative/ organisations; - Awareness raised on the economic needs of vulnerable groups.

• CERD staff, in partnership with other CSO, conducted a research on the current status of the organic agricultural production in BiH. Based on the findings, CERD published a policy paper on the current status of the organic production and concrete recommendations for the improvement. The most important outcome of this initiative is improved environment for the development of organic production that represents potential for income generation among small producers. • CERD has prepared the module for practical financial inclusion of women and youth from rural area. CERD has concluded an agreement with the most important financial institution for the members of the rural community – “Partner”. Based on the agreement “Partner” will present the most suitable financial services for the members of the rural community (especially women) enabling them to have access to those financial services and encourage them to use their entrepreneurship potential. • During 2018, for the first time in Bosnia and Herzegovina, School for Organic Production was organised by CERD. In total, 25 small-scale farmers who are farming according to the organic principles got a chance to have intensive and comprehensive education regarding this topic. • CERD has developed an Action Plan for Organisational Development, based on the external evaluation of the Organisational Capacities Development conducted at the end of 2017 by We Effect and an external consultant. The implementation of the Action Plan is followed up by We Effect and CERD.

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Economic and Rural Development

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity

receiver-org.narrative: Centre for Economic and Rural Development
